virtualObjectInfo.usage: A container that opens to reveal storage space for holding items

virtualObjectInfo.usage: Players would pick it up, hold it, pose it, and engage in imaginative play scenarios.
virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Because the plush doll is light and compressible, users pick it up between thumb and fingers with a gentle precision grip around the torso or head. They may squeeze or pivot it in mid-air, shake it playfully, or position its limbs with small pinching gestures. The object visually yields slightly but always springs back, encouraging repeated soft squeezes and rapid pose changes.

virtualObjectInfo.usage: Optical viewing device for magnifying distant objects
virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Players wrap both hands around the optical barrels using two symmetrical power grips, thumbs resting on top while index fingers hover near focus wheels. Hands are raised to eye level with elbow flexion and slight wrist pronation. Users may roll the focus wheels with fingertip precision, then tilt their head and arms to scan the environment. The binoculars feel moderately heavy and resist rapid lateral acceleration, simulating real glass lenses inside.

virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Users wrap fingers around the vertical grip with a power grip. proxyLocation: floor / lounge corner where the bean-bag normally sits
utilizationMethod: Stand beside the bean bag and give its soft, loosely-filled surface a light slap or flick with your fingertips. The fabric sinks with almost no resistance and slowly rebounds, mimicking the gentle give and delayed return you feel when tapping an air-filled balloon.

virtualObjectInfo.usage: These party balloons would be used for playful interaction in celebration VR environments. VR players would flick or tap floating balloons to set them in motion.
virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Users lightly tap or flick the balloon surfaces with fingertips or the back of the hand. Contact is quick and gentle, imparting small impulses that send the balloons drifting away. Because of low virtual mass, they wobble and ascend or bob erratically. Players may also bat them with an open palm for longer pushes, feeling almost no resistance.

virtualObjectInfo.usage: This desktop globe would be used for educational exploration in classroom. VR players would rotate the sphere to navigate around the world.
virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Users place an open palm or several fingertips against the sphere, then apply sideways force while maintaining contact, resulting in a smooth rotational spin about its tilted axis. Small pushes yield slow rotation; stronger swipes accelerate the globe. Friction gradually slows it, encouraging repeated spins and stops for geographic inspection.

The chair is stable and unmoving; users can lean against the curved backrest or shift posture, causing small frictional slides but no perceptible chair displacement.

virtualObjectInfo.usage: VR players would run their hands across the sculptural surfaces to appreciate the craftsmanship
virtualObjectInfo.interactionDeduction: Players glide fingers along the contours of the marble-like sculpture, tracing facial features and flowing hair. The bust is rigid, cool, and smooth, offering no movement but allowing tactile appreciation of carved ridges and planes.
